channel.description: Recent content in git on dyrone's blog

item.title: About Git Multi Points Representation
item.description: If we read the ‘git-rev-list.txt’ in git project on github or in git rev-list --help output. You can find there are some the related description about multi points in git. The multiple points notation in git rev-list intents to select a range of commits on the repository commit graph. Two Points Notation: “..” A special notation "<commit1>..<commit2>" can be used as a short-hand for "^'<commit1>' <commit2>". For example, either of the following may be used interchangeably: $ git rev-list origin.
